About Dr. Mary Jo Trepka
Dr. Mary Jo Trepka is a professor and chair of the Department of Epidemiology at the FIU Robert Stempel College of Public Health & Social Work. She is board certified in preventive medicine and public health and was trained as an epidemic intelligence service officer by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Before joining FIU in 2003, she served as Miami-Dade Countyâ€™s epidemiologist and was responsible for the surveillance and control of infectious diseases.
About the Faculty Lecture Series
The Faculty Lecture Series is an initiative designed to connect students, faculty, staff, and the broader community with timely, expert-led insights on todayâ€™s most pressing health-related topics. The lecture series was created by the Academic Health Center team to feature presentations by FIU faculty and leading healthcare experts on a range of subjects including emerging research, medical innovations, public health issues, and the evolving landscape of healthcare technology and policy. Each session offers attendees the opportunity to engage with experts, deepen their understanding of current health challenges, and explore the future of health and medicine.

Debbie Wasserman Schultz (D-FL), Rep. Jo Ann Emerson (R-MO), Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) and Sen. Susan Collins (R-ME). They brought together a team of women Members of Congress to play the female campaign staff from both parties after Debbie Wasserman Schultz announced her own battle with breast cancer. In 2010, the Members asked the women of the Washington, D.C. press corps to join the game as the opponent and a lasting rivalry was born. The Congressional Womenâ€™s Softball Game has raised more than $3.7M for Young Survival Coalition (YSC) since the Game began and has become a staple of Capitol Hill summer activities. 
YSC is the premier global organization dedicated to the critical issues unique to young adults who are diagnosed with breast cancer. They offer resources, connections and outreach so young adults feel supported, empowered and hopeful. Breast cancer is something few young women ever think will happen to them â€“ and certainly not at such an early age. When faced with a diagnosis, they may feel confused, angry and isolated. YSC is a place where young adults can go to find a circle of support and the best information available to navigate their treatment and their lives.

12:30 to 2:00 p.m. 
FIU College of Law 
Free and open to the FIU academic community and the public 
September 30, 2024: Blockchain 101: Everything you need to know about blockchain technology, its regulation, and crimes (RDB 1006). 
October 14, 2024: Blockchain and Elections: Which Presidential candidate will be much better for crypto prices and blockchain development? (RDB 2080). 
November 5, 2024: Two Years Later: Why did FTX fail? Is Sam Bankman a monster or misunderstood whiz kid? (RDB 2080). 
November 26, 2024: Just in time for the Holidays: How to successfully invest and make money in digital assets/crypto/blockchain businesses? (RDB 2080). 
This series is presented by the Office of International and Graduates Studies at FIU Law. 
About the speaker: Adjunct Professor Marc Powers is a Chambers Ranked Securities Law and Litigation Partner Retired from Law Firm Practice with 40 years of legal experience, including his last 20 years at two AMLAW 50 law firms and five years at SEC. Powers has demonstrated expertise in advising both U.S. and foreign businesses in all their legal affairs, including Securities Regulation, SEC Defense, Corporate Governance, Cryptocurrencies and other Blockchain related matters.

<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. Made possible with the support of the City of Miami Beach Department of Tourism and Cultural Development, Office of Cultural Affairs, and the Miami Beach Mayor and City Commissioners.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/creole-archive-project-polone-nwa-constitution-1805-exhibition-by-dr-jacek-kolasinski">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Creole+Archive+Project%3A+Polon%C3%A9+Nwa+-+Constitution+1805+Exhibition+by+Dr.+Jacek+Kolasi%C5%84ski&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+May+20%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AFriday%2C+May+9%2C+2025.+To+celebrate+Haitian+Heritage+Month%2C+the+Creole+Archive+Project%3A+Polon%C3%A9+Nwa+-+Constitution+1805+by+Dr.+Jacek+Kolasi%C5%84ski+invites+viewers+to+uncover+a+powerful+and+often+forgotten+chapter+of+Haitian+and+Polish+history.+The+exhibition+explores+the+unlikely+alliance+between+Polish+legionnaires+and+Haitian+revolutionaries+during+the+fight+for+Haiti%E2%80%99s+independence.+The+exhibition+is+on+view+through+June+27%2C+2025.+Design+Gallery%2C+SoA+Miami+Beach+Urban+Studios%2C+420+Lincoln+Rd%2C+Miami+Beach%2C+FL.+Free+and+open+to+the+public.+Made+possible+with+the+support+of+the+City+of+Miami+Beach+Department+of+Tourism+and+Cultural+Development%2C+Office+of+Cultural+Affairs%2C+and+the+Miami+Beach+Mayor+and+City+Commissioners.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcreole-archive-project-polone-nwa-constitution-1805-exhibition-by-dr-jacek-kolasinski%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>May 21, 2025: Cubaâ€™s Eternal Night at RDB - Rafael Diaz-Balart Law Building</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>What has become of Cuba since the historic protests of July 11, 2021â€”and the regimeâ€™s swift and brutal crackdown? Cubaâ€™s Eternal Night follows 5 Cubans over 2 harrowing years as they struggle with government repression, scarcity of food and medicine, and the biggest mass exodus the island has ever experienced. Yet amidst the darkness, these five individuals choose to share their lives, boldly and on camera, offering a rare and intimate look inside a nation unraveling. <br /> <br />Jordan Allott is a documentary filmmaker and founder of In Altum Productions (IAP). His work explores themes ranging from international human rights and American politics to Catholic spirituality. <br /> <br />Yoe SuÃ¡rez is an award-winning journalist and writer. He was an independent journalist in Cuba during the filming and became the filmÂ´s field producer. He now lives in the U.S. <br /> <br />Father Alberto Reyes PÃ­as is a Roman Catholic priest in the Archdiocese of CamagÃ¼ey, Cuba. He is one of the most articulate and courageous voices on freedom in Cuba today. <br /> <br />This event is free and open to the public. It will be held in Spanish. <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. <item>
<title>May 27, 2025: Faculty Lecture Series: All eyes on Measles at SASC - Student Academic Success Center</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Join us for All Eyes on Measlesâ€”the first event in FIU Academic Health Center's new Faculty Lecture Seriesâ€”and learn from one of our top public health experts. Dr. Mary Jo Trepka, Chair and Professor of Epidemiology at Stempel College, will discuss the history of measles, its current resurgence, and its impact on public health.</p> <p> </p> <p>This lecture is open to all FIU students, faculty, and staff. It is offered at no cost and lunch will be served. </p> <p> </p> <p>Tuesday, May 27, 2025 | 11:30 a.m. - 1:00 p.m.</p> <p> SASC, 160 | FIU Modesto A. Maidique Campus </p> <p> </p> <p>About Dr. Mary Jo Trepka</p> <p> </p> <p>Dr. Mary Jo Trepka is a professor and chair of the Department of Epidemiology at the FIU Robert Stempel College of Public Health &amp; Social Work. She is board certified in preventive medicine and public health and was trained as an epidemic intelligence service officer by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Before joining FIU in 2003, she served as Miami-Dade Countyâ€™s epidemiologist and was responsible for the surveillance and control of infectious diseases.</p> <p> </p> <p>About the Faculty Lecture Series</p> <p> </p> <p>The Faculty Lecture Series is an initiative designed to connect students, faculty, staff, and the broader community with timely, expert-led insights on todayâ€™s most pressing health-related topics. The lecture series was created by the Academic Health Center team to feature presentations by FIU faculty and leading healthcare experts on a range of subjects including emerging research, medical innovations, public health issues, and the evolving landscape of healthcare technology and policy. Each session offers attendees the opportunity to engage with experts, deepen their understanding of current health challenges, and explore the future of health and medicine.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/all-eyes-on-measles">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Faculty+Lecture+Series%3A+All+eyes+on+Measles&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+May+27%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AJoin+us+for+All+Eyes+on+Measles%E2%80%94the+first+event+in+FIU+Academic+Health+Center%27s+new+Faculty+Lecture+Series%E2%80%94and+learn+from+one+of+our+top+public+health+experts.+Dr.+Mary+Jo+Trepka%2C+Chair+and+Professor+of+Epidemiology+at+Stempel+College%2C+will+discuss+the+history+of+measles%2C+its+current+resurgence%2C+and+its+impact+on+public+health.%0A%0A+%0A%0AThis+lecture+is+open+to+all+FIU+students%2C+faculty%2C+and+staff.+It+is+offered+at+no+cost+and+lunch+will+be+served.+%0A%0A+%0A%0ATuesday%2C+May+27%2C+2025+%7C+11%3A30+a.m.+-+1%3A00+p.m.%0A%0A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++SASC%2C+160+%7C+FIU+Modesto+A.+Maidique+Campus+%0A%0A+%0A%0AAbout+Dr.+Mary+Jo+Trepka%0A%0A+%0A%0ADr.+Mary+Jo+Trepka+is+a+professor+and+chair+of+the+Department+of+Epidemiology+at+the+FIU+Robert+Stempel+College+of+Public+Health+%26+Social+Work.+She+is+board+certified+in+preventive+medicine+and+public+health+and+was+trained+as+an+epidemic+intelligence+service+officer+by+the+Centers+for+Disease+Control+and+Prevention.+Before+joining+FIU+in+2003%2C+she+served+as+Miami-Dade+County%E2%80%99s+epidemiologist+and+was+responsible+for+the+surveillance+and+control+of+infectious+diseases.%0A%0A+%0A%0AAbout+the+Faculty+Lecture+Series%0A%0A+%0A%0AThe+Faculty+Lecture+Series+is+an+initiative+designed+to+connect+students%2C+faculty%2C+staff%2C+and+the+broader+community+with+timely%2C+expert-led+insights+on+today%E2%80%99s+most+pressing+health-related+topics.+The+lecture+series+was+created+by+the+Academic+Health+Center+team+to+feature+presentations+by+FIU+faculty+and+leading+healthcare+experts+on+a+range+of+subjects+including+emerging+research%2C+medical+innovations%2C+public+health+issues%2C+and+the+evolving+landscape+of+healthcare+technology+and+policy.+Each+session+offers+attendees+the+opportunity+to+ <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. <title>May 29, 2025: Language, Culture and Society in Havana in 1830 at GL - Green Library</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The objective of this conference is to identify particularities of that interest in the Spanish language and the inclination for lexicographic activity in Cuba in the years before the appearance of Esteban Pichardoâ€™s Diccionario provincial de voces cubanas in 1836. This conference reconstructs the creative and bibliographic environment of that pioneering group in 1830, who had the good sense to work as a team, recognize aspects of Cuban identity, and capture the various voices and phrases used by their contemporaries on the island.</p> <p>GUEST SPEAKER: Dr. Armando ChÃ¡vez-Rivera. Associate Professor and Director of the Spanish Program at the University of Houston-Victoria, Texas, and a Scholar in Residence at the Kluge Center at the Library of Congress. Member of the North American Academy of the Spanish Language.</p> <p>This event is co-sponsored by the Kimberly Green Latin America and Caribbean Center and FIU Libraries. This event is made possible with the support of LACC's Department of Education Title VI Grant. This effort resulted in a vocabulary that remained unpublished for 190 years, until Dr. ChÃ¡vez-Rivera edited and published it in 2021. The original manuscript circulated in the XIX century and was an influence on the island and abroad. The objective of this conference is to identify particularities of that interest in the Spanish language and the inclination for lexicographic activity in Cuba in the years prior to the appearance of Esteban Pichardoâ€™s Diccionario provincial de voces cubanas in 1836. <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Capitol Hill Ocean Week (CHOW) is the nationâ€™s premier ocean and Great Lakes policy conference hosted by the National Marine Sanctuary Foundation that convenes policymakers, scientists, managers, business leaders, conservationists, educators, students, and members of the public to engage in dialogue and debate on significant issues that impact our ocean and Great Lakes and to propose innovative policies and partnerships to address these issues. For more information, please visit the National Marine Sanctuary Foundation website.</p> <p>Each year, thousands of people who have a stake in the future of our waters and our planet converge at CHOW to hear from the preeminent voicesâ€”and future leadersâ€”in our industry, glimpse the future of marine technology, and meet the policymakers eliciting change on the local, state, national and global levels. The topics discussed at CHOW become the mainstream headlines about our ocean, coasts and Great Lakes, and all are welcome to the dialogue. And we need your voice too.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/chow-conference-capitol-hill-ocean-week">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+CHOW+Conference+%28Capitol+Hill+Ocean+Week%29&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+4%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0ACapitol+Hill+Ocean+Week+%28CHOW%29+is+the+nation%E2%80%99s+premier+ocean+and+Great+Lakes+policy+conference+hosted+by+the+National+Marine+Sanctuary+Foundation+that+convenes+policymakers%2C+scientists%2C+managers%2C+business+leaders%2C+conservationists%2C+educators%2C+students%2C+and+members+of+the+public+to+engage+in+dialogue+and+debate+on+significant+issues+that+impact+our+ocean+and+Great+Lakes+and+to+propose+innovative+policies+and+partnerships+to+address+these+issues.+For+more+information%2C+please+visit+the+National+Marine+Sanctuary+Foundation+website.%0A%0AEach+year%2C+thousands+of+people+who+have+a+stake+in+the+future+of+our+waters+and+our+planet+converge+at+CHOW+to+hear+from+the+preeminent+voices%E2%80%94and+future+leaders%E2%80%94in+our+industry%2C+glimpse+the+future+of+marine+technology%2C+and+meet+the+policymakers+eliciting+change+on+the+local%2C+state%2C+national+and+global+levels.+The+topics+discussed+at+CHOW+become+the+mainstream+headlines+about+our+ocean%2C+coasts+and+Great+Lakes%2C+and+all+are+welcome+to+the+dialogue.+And+we+need+your+voice+too.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fchow-conference-capitol-hill-ocean-week%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Jun 4, 2025: 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium will present ground-breaking forensic science research from 40 experts worldwide. This unique event brings together law enforcement agencies, industry, and academia to share knowledge and training for laboratory professionals. Our theme this year is Collaboration in Forensic Scienceâ€”an essential practice to advance the disciplines across campus and around the world.</p> <p>Presentation topics include: Medico-Legal Death Investigation, DNA, Genetic Genealogy, Toxicology, Canine Sensors, Illicit Drug Trade, Contamination Detection, Trace Evidence, Nanotechnology, Explosives, Crime Scene Photography, Chemical Analysis, Quantification, Fingerprint Development, Digital and Crypto Forensics, Mass Disaster Victim Management, Firearms, Accreditation, Certification, and Laboratory Operations.</p> <p>Schedule: <br />Tuesday, June 3: In-person, MARC 290, and live-streamed online <br />Wednesday &amp; Thursday, June 4 &amp; 5: Livestream only</p> <p>Whether you attend in-person or virtually - registration is FREE! </p> <p>Register today at go.fiu.edu/FSSregistration.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/2025-global-forensic-science-symposium">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+2025+Global+Forensic+Science+Symposium&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+4%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThe+2025+Global+Forensic+Science+Symposium+will+present+ground-breaking+forensic+science+research+from+40+experts+worldwide.+This+unique+event+brings+together+law+enforcement+agencies%2C+industry%2C+and+academia+to+share+knowledge+and+training+for+laboratory+professionals.+Our+theme+this+year+is+Collaboration+in+Forensic+Science%E2%80%94an+essential+practice+to+advance+the+disciplines+across+campus+and+around+the+world.%0A%0APresentation+topics+include%3A+Medico-Legal+Death+Investigation%2C+DNA%2C+Genetic+Genealogy%2C+Toxicology%2C+Canine+Sensors%2C+Illicit+Drug+Trade%2C+Contamination+Detection%2C+Trace+Evidence%2C+Nanotechnology%2C+Explosives%2C+Crime+Scene+Photography%2C+Chemical+Analysis%2C+Quantification%2C+Fingerprint+Development%2C+Digital+and+Crypto+Forensics%2C+Mass+Disaster+Victim+Management%2C+Firearms%2C+Accreditation%2C+Certification%2C+and+Laboratory+Operations.%0A%0ASchedule%3A%0ATuesday%2C+June+3%3A+In-person%2C+MARC+290%2C+and+live-streamed+online%0AWednesday+%26+Thursday%2C+June+4+%26+5%3A+Livestream+only%0A%0AWhether+you+attend+in-person+or+virtually+-+registration+is+FREE%21+%0A%0ARegister+today+at+go.fiu.edu%2FFSSregistration.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2F2025-global-forensic-science-symposium%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<item>
<title>Jun 4, 2025: 2025 Tiananmen Sqaure Massacre Candlelight Vigil at Intersection of Massachusetts and New Jersey Avenues and G Street, NW</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Join VOC on June 4 at the Victims of Communism Memorial to honor the legacy of the brave individuals who stood for freedom at our annual Tiananmen Square Massacre candlelight vigil.</p> <p>Every year, VOC commemorates what happened on June 4, 1989, when the Chinese Communist Party crushed a massive pro-democracy movement by sending tanks into Tiananmen Square. Beijing has since erased all mention of June 4 from its history. We still do not know the death toll.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/2025-tiananmen-sqaure-massacre-candlelight-vigil">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+2025+Tiananmen+Sqaure+Massacre+Candlelight+Vigil+&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+4%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AJoin+VOC+on+June+4+at+the+Victims+of+Communism+Memorial+to+honor+the+legacy+of+the+brave+individuals+who+stood+for+freedom+at+our+annual+Tiananmen+Square+Massacre+candlelight+vigil.%0A%0AEvery+year%2C+VOC+commemorates+what+happened+on+June+4%2C+1989%2C+when+the+Chinese+Communist+Party+crushed+a+massive+pro-democracy+movement+by+sending+tanks+into+Tiananmen+Square.+Beijing+has+since+erased+all+mention+of+June+4+from+its+history.+We+still+do+not+know+the+death+toll.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2F2025-tiananmen-sqaure-massacre-candlelight-vigil%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Jun 5, 2025: 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The 2025 Global Forensic Science Symposium will present ground-breaking forensic science research from 40 experts worldwide. This unique event brings together law enforcement agencies, industry, and academia to share knowledge and training for laboratory professionals. Our theme this year is Collaboration in Forensic Scienceâ€”an essential practice to advance the disciplines across campus and around the world.</p> <p>Presentation topics include: Medico-Legal Death Investigation, DNA, Genetic Genealogy, Toxicology, Canine Sensors, Illicit Drug Trade, Contamination Detection, Trace Evidence, Nanotechnology, Explosives, Crime Scene Photography, Chemical Analysis, Quantification, Fingerprint Development, Digital and Crypto Forensics, Mass Disaster Victim Management, Firearms, Accreditation, Certification, and Laboratory Operations.</p> <p>Schedule: <br />Tuesday, June 3: In-person, MARC 290, and live-streamed online <br />Wednesday &amp; Thursday, June 4 &amp; 5: Livestream only</p> <p>Whether you attend in-person or virtually - registration is FREE! <description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Tackle the practical application of integrating AI into your courses. Generative AI and Large Language Models have the power to redefine our teaching work in the classroom. In these three half-day workshops, participants will leverage them to enhance their teaching and learning practices. <item>
<title>Jun 11, 2025: Congressional Baseball Game at Nationals Park</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Since 1909 the Congressional Baseball Game has been an annual bipartisan event beloved by all and enjoyed by thousands. Members of the United States Congress from each party solidify friendships off the floor and on the field. Over the last century, the Congressional Baseball Gameâ€™s popularity has contributed to its evolution into a foundation called Congressional Sports for Charity. Created in 2016, Congressional Sports for Charity provides support to worthy and effective charities serving vulnerable children and families in the Washington DC area as well as scholarships to deserving local youth. These charities include the Boys and Girls Clubs of Greater Washington and the Washington Nationals Philanthropies along with the United States Capitol Police Memorial Fund in gratitude to the brave officers at the Republican practice shooting on June 14, 2017.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/congressional-baseball-game">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Congressional+Baseball+Game&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+11%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0ASince+1909+the+Congressional+Baseball+Game+has+been+an+annual+bipartisan+event+beloved+by+all+and+enjoyed+by+thousands.+Members+of+the+United+States+Congress+from+each+party+solidify+friendships+off+the+floor+and+on+the+field.+Over+the+last+century%2C+the+Congressional+Baseball+Game%E2%80%99s+popularity+has+contributed+to+its+evolution+into+a+foundation+called+Congressional+Sports+for+Charity.+Created+in+2016%2C+Congressional+Sports+for+Charity+provides+support+to+worthy+and+effective+charities+serving+vulnerable+children+and+families+in+the+Washington+DC+area+as+well+as+scholarships+to+deserving+local+youth.+These+charities+include+the+Boys+and+Girls+Clubs+of+Greater+Washington+and+the+Washington+Nationals+Philanthropies+along+with+the+United+States+Capitol+Police+Memorial+Fund+in+gratitude+to+the+brave+officers+at+the+Republican+practice+shooting+on+June+14%2C+2017.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcongressional-baseball-game%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Jun 11, 2025: 5 Signs the Job is a Scam</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>In today's competitive landscape, exciting opportunities can seem like a lifeline. Unfortunately, so can sophisticated job scams designed to steal your personal information, your money, and your time.</p> <p> </p> <p>This workshop will equip you with the knowledge and skills to navigate the job search safely and confidently. We'll pull back the curtain on the tactic's scammers use, revealing the red flags that often go unnoticed. <title>Jun 17, 2025: Atlantic Council: 2025 Global Energy Forum at Waldorf Astoria</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The Atlantic Council Global Energy Forum is the go-to conference for navigating the geopolitics energy.</p> <p>Seizing on the momentum of a new US administration in the White House, we are excited to announce that the ninth Atlantic Council Global Energy Forum will take place on June 17-18, 2025, in Washington, DC, with a focus on Collaboration, Competition, and Security: A new era of leadership shaping the future of the global energy system.</p> <p>Energy underpins every facet of national security, economic growth, and the pursuit of a sustainable future. That is why we invite you to join us this spring as we host the worldâ€™s top energy and foreign policy decisionmakers to explore the geopolitical and geoeconomic implications of the changing energy system.</p> <p>For more information on partnership opportunities, please contact the team at <a href="mailto:GEF@AtlanticCouncil.org">GEF@AtlanticCouncil.org</a>.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/atlantic-council-2025-global-energy-forum">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Atlantic+Council%3A+2025+Global+Energy+Forum&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+17%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThe+Atlantic+Council+Global+Energy+Forum+is+the+go-to+conference+for+navigating+the+geopolitics+energy.%0A%0ASeizing+on+the+momentum+of+a+new+US+administration+in+the+White+House%2C+we+are+excited+to+announce+that+the+ninth+Atlantic+Council+Global+Energy+Forum+will+take+place+on+June+17-18%2C+2025%2C+in+Washington%2C+DC%2C+with+a+focus+on+Collaboration%2C+Competition%2C+and+Security%3A+A+new+era+of+leadership+shaping+the+future+of+the+global+energy+system.%0A%0AEnergy+underpins+every+facet+of+national+security%2C+economic+growth%2C+and+the+pursuit+of+a+sustainable+future.+That+is+why+we+invite+you+to+join+us+this+spring+as+we+host+the+world%E2%80%99s+top+energy+and+foreign+policy+decisionmakers+to+explore+the+geopolitical+and+geoeconomic+implications+of+the+changing+energy+system.%0A%0AFor+more+information+on+partnership+opportunities%2C+please+contact+the+team+at+GEF%40AtlanticCouncil.org.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fatlantic-council-2025-global-energy-forum%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Jun 17, 2025: Teaching with AI Workshop</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Tackle the practical application of integrating AI into your courses. Generative AI and Large Language Models have the power to redefine our teaching work in the classroom. In these three half-day workshops, participants will leverage them to enhance their teaching and learning practices. <title>Jun 18, 2025: AI Workshop for Course Design & Preparation</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>This intermediate-level online workshop is designed for faculty seeking to thoughtfully integrate artificial intelligence into their teaching practices to enhance both course design and student engagement. Led by Marc Weinstein, CAT AI Faculty Fellow, the session will provide participants with evidence-based approaches to leveraging AI tools for curriculum development, instructional innovation, and pedagogical efficiency.</p> <p>Building on foundational AI knowledge, the workshop will examine practical applications of AI for streamlining course preparation, generating instructional content, fostering active learning, and facilitating timely, personalized feedback. Special emphasis will be placed on aligning AI-enhanced practices with sound pedagogical principles and maintaining academic integrity.</p> <p>Participants will engage in critical discussions on the ethical and responsible use of AI in higher education, explore case studies, and gain hands-on experience with AI-driven tools that support student-centered learning. By the conclusion of the workshop, faculty will have developed actionable strategies for enhancing teaching effectiveness and enriching the student learning experience.</p> <p>Prerequisite: A basic familiarity with AI tools or prior participation in an introductory AI in teaching workshop is recommended.</p> <p><a <item>
<title>Jun 19, 2025: FIU Celebrates Juneteenth</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Juneteenth celebrates African American freedom and achievement, while encouraging continuous self-development. As recommended in our Equity Action Initiative, FIU seeks to align with the spirit of this holiday, to make Juneteenth an official day of observance at Florida International University. Additionally, we stand in support of the Student Government Association of Florida.</p> <p>The theme for FIU first inaugural Juneteenth celebration is â€œEducate, Celebrate, and Healâ€. Educating, celebrating, and embracing the truths of Juneteenth can serve to expand the collective knowledge of our entire FIU community and accelerate an appreciation for the Black history excluded from pedagogy, that may have framed a different America. Celebrating Juneteenth complements the work of the Founding Fathers, being the architects of the Declaration of Independence, and brings to the conversation, the 400 years Blacks have tried to achieve equality in enjoying â€˜life, liberty and the pursuit of happinessâ€™. During this week of observance, we will provide programming and activities to commemorate Juneteenth beginning June 14 and culminating with a Juneteenth Freedom Day Celebration on Saturday, June 19 from 10am to 4pm. To learn more about this celebration, visit <a href="https://ace.fiu.edu/juneteenth/">https://ace.fiu.edu/juneteenth/</a></p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/fiu_celebrates_juneteenth">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+FIU+Celebrates+Juneteenth&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+19%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AJuneteenth+celebrates+African+American+freedom+and+achievement%2C+while+encouraging+continuous+self-development.+As+recommended+in+our+Equity+Action+Initiative%2C+FIU+seeks+to+align+with+the+spirit+of+this+holiday%2C+to+make+Juneteenth+an+official+day+of+observance+at+Florida+International+University.+Additionally%2C+we+stand+in+support+of+the+Student+Government+Association+of+Florida.%0A%0AThe+theme+for+FIU+first+inaugural+Juneteenth+celebration+is+%E2%80%9CEducate%2C+Celebrate%2C+and+Heal%E2%80%9D.+Educating%2C+celebrating%2C+and+embracing+the+truths+of+Juneteenth+can+serve+to+expand+the+collective+knowledge+of+our+entire+FIU+community+and+accelerate+an+appreciation+for+the+Black+history+excluded+from+pedagogy%2C+that+may+have+framed+a+different+America.+Celebrating+Juneteenth+complements+the+work+of+the+Founding+Fathers%2C+being+the+architects+of+the+Declaration+of+Independence%2C+and+brings+to+the+conversation%2C+the+400+years+Blacks+have+tried+to+achieve+equality+in+enjoying+%E2%80%98life%2C+liberty+and+the+pursuit+of+happiness%E2%80%99.+During+this+week+of+observance%2C+we+will+provide+programming+and+activities+to+commemorate+Juneteenth+beginning+June+14+and+culminating+with+a+Juneteenth+Freedom+Day+Celebration+on+Saturday%2C+June+19+from+10am+to+4pm.+To+learn+more+about+this+celebration%2C+visit+https%3A%2F%2Face.fiu.edu%2Fjuneteenth%2F%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Ffiu_celebrates_juneteenth%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. <title>Jun 23, 2025: Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 Exhibition by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski at MBUS - SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. Made possible with the support of the City of Miami Beach Department of Tourism and Cultural Development, Office of Cultural Affairs, and the Miami Beach Mayor and City Commissioners.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/creole-archive-project-polone-nwa-constitution-1805-exhibition-by-dr-jacek-kolasinski">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Creole+Archive+Project%3A+Polon%C3%A9+Nwa+-+Constitution+1805+Exhibition+by+Dr.+Jacek+Kolasi%C5%84ski&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+23%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AFriday%2C+May+9%2C+2025.+To+celebrate+Haitian+Heritage+Month%2C+the+Creole+Archive+Project%3A+Polon%C3%A9+Nwa+-+Constitution+1805+by+Dr.+Jacek+Kolasi%C5%84ski+invites+viewers+to+uncover+a+powerful+and+often+forgotten+chapter+of+Haitian+and+Polish+history.+The+exhibition+explores+the+unlikely+alliance+between+Polish+legionnaires+and+Haitian+revolutionaries+during+the+fight+for+Haiti%E2%80%99s+independence.+The+exhibition+is+on+view+through+June+27%2C+2025.+Design+Gallery%2C+SoA+Miami+Beach+Urban+Studios%2C+420+Lincoln+Rd%2C+Miami+Beach%2C+FL.+Free+and+open+to+the+public.+Made+possible+with+the+support+of+the+City+of+Miami+Beach+Department+of+Tourism+and+Cultural+Development%2C+Office+of+Cultural+Affairs%2C+and+the+Miami+Beach+Mayor+and+City+Commissioners.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcreole-archive-project-polone-nwa-constitution-1805-exhibition-by-dr-jacek-kolasinski%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<item>
<title>Jun 24, 2025: 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference at GC - Graham University Center</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Hello Panther!</p> <p>Interested in learning more about public service career opportunities? Did you know the local, state, and federal government agencies and departments offer internships, full-time and part-time career opportunities and fellowships? Join us at the 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference to meet hiring managers, recruiters, and representatives! Learn about preparing for and applying to federal career opportunities!</p> <p>Date: Tuesday June 24th, 2025</p> <p>Time: 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EDT</p> <p>Location: Florida International University, Modesto A. Maidique Campus, Graham Center, GC Ballroom</p> <p>Address: 11200 SW 8th St, Miami, FL 33199</p> <p> </p> <p>This 20th Annual Government Statewide Conference is designed to bring representatives from various government entities together to discuss aspects of government employment, best practices, employment opportunities, and several other relevant topics geared for students, alumni, professionals, and veterans.</p> <p>After our speaker and panelist sessions on government employment, we host a resource fair for participating agencies and students will get the opportunity to visit and network with each other.</p> <p>The 20th Annual Government Conference is open to FIU students and alumni as well as Miami-Dade College and State University System of Florida students. All must register to attend on Handshake. All student attendees must present a college or university ID to be admitted.</p> <p>If you have any questions, please contact Career and Talent Development at <a href="mailto:career@fiu.edu">career@fiu.edu</a> or call (305) 348-2423</p> <p>Government Statewide Conference is open to all current FIU students and alumni</p> <p>Should you need an ADA accommodation to participate in this event, or to request materials in an accessible format, please contact FIUâ€™s Office of Civil Rights Compliance and Accessibility (CRCA) at 305-348-2785 or <a href="mailto:ocrca@fiu.edu">ocrca@fiu.edu</a>. All requests for ADA accommodations or accessible materials for this event must be submitted to CRCA at least two weeks prior to the event or at the earliest possible opportunity.</p> <p>RSVP Via (72) Handshake</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/20th-annual-government-statewide-conference">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+24%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AHello+Panther%21%0A%0AInterested+in+learning+more+about+public+service+career+opportunities%3F+Did+you+know+the+local%2C+state%2C+and+federal+government+agencies+and+departments+offer+internships%2C+full-time+and+part-time+career+opportunities+and+fellowships%3F+Join+us+at+the+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference+to+meet+hiring+managers%2C+recruiters%2C+and+representatives%21+Learn+about+preparing+for+and+applying+to+federal+career+opportunities%21%0A%0ADate%3A+Tuesday+June+24th%2C+2025%0A%0ATime%3A+9%3A00+a.m.+to+5%3A00+p.m.+EDT%0A%0ALocation%3A+Florida+International+University%2C+Modesto+A.+Maidique+Campus%2C+Graham+Center%2C+GC+Ballroom%0A%0AAddress%3A+11200+SW+8th+St%2C+Miami%2C+FL+33199%0A%0A+%0A%0AThis+20th+Annual+Government+Statewide+Conference+is+designed+to+bring+representatives+from+various+government+entities+together+to+discuss+aspects+of+government+employment%2C+best+practices%2C+employment+opportunities%2C+and+several+other+relevant+topics+geared+for+students%2C+alumni%2C+professionals%2C+and+veterans.%0A%0AAfter+our+speaker+and+panelist+sessions+on+government+employment%2C+we+host+a+resource+fair+for+participating+agencies+and+students+will+get+the+opportunity+to+visit+and+network+with+each+other.%0A%0AThe+20th+Annual+Government+Conference+is+open+to+FIU+students+and+alumni+as+well+as+Miami-Dade+College+and+State+University+System+of+Florida+students.+All+must+register+to+attend+on+Handshake.+All+student+attendees+must+present+a+college+or+university+ID+to+be+admitted.%0A%0AIf+you+have+any+questions%2C+please+contact+Career+and+Talent+Development+at+career%40fiu.edu+or+call+%28305%29+348-2423%0A%0AGovernment+Statewide+Conference+is+open+to+all+current+FIU+students+and+alumni%0A%0AShould+you+need+an+ADA+accommodation+to+participate+in+this+even <item>
<title>Jun 24, 2025: Teaching with AI Workshop</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Tackle the practical application of integrating AI into your courses. Generative AI and Large Language Models have the power to redefine our teaching work in the classroom. In these three half-day workshops, participants will leverage them to enhance their teaching and learning practices. In particular, this workshop will address:</p> <p>Redesigning our lessons using AI,Creating AI-enhanced assignments and assessments,Teaching students how to use AI ethically, andAddressing academic integrity concerns.Facilitated by GÃ¡ramis Campusano, EdTech Specialist, Center for the Advancement of Teaching</p> <p>Fulfills Certificate Requirement: Syllabus and Course Design or Elective</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/ai-in-action-workshop-designing-effective-assignments-and-assessments-for-ai-enhanced-learning">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Teaching+with+AI+Workshop&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jun+24%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0ATackle+the+practical+application+of+integrating+AI+into+your+courses.+Generative+AI+and+Large+Language+Models+have+the+power+to+redefine+our+teaching+work+in+the+classroom.+In+these+three+half-day+workshops%2C+participants+will+leverage+them+to+enhance+their+teaching+and+learning+practices.+In+particular%2C+this+workshop+will+address%3A%0A%0ARedesigning+our+lessons+using+AI%2CCreating+AI-enhanced+assignments+and+assessments%2CTeaching+students+how+to+use+AI+ethically%2C+andAddressing+academic+integrity+concerns.Facilitated+by+G%C3%A1ramis+Campusano%2C+EdTech+Specialist%2C+Center+for+the+Advancement+of+Teaching%0A%0AFulfills+Certificate+Requirement%3A+Syllabus+and+Course+Design+or+Elective%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fai-in-action-workshop-designing-effective-assignments-and-assessments-for-ai-enhanced-learning%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. <![CDATA[ <p>Friday, May 9, 2025. To celebrate Haitian Heritage Month, the Creole Archive Project: PolonÃ© Nwa - Constitution 1805 by Dr. Jacek KolasiÅ„ski invites viewers to uncover a powerful and often forgotten chapter of Haitian and Polish history. The exhibition explores the unlikely alliance between Polish legionnaires and Haitian revolutionaries during the fight for Haitiâ€™s independence. The exhibition is on view through June 27, 2025. Design Gallery, SoA Miami Beach Urban Studios, 420 Lincoln Rd, Miami Beach, FL. Free and open to the public. <item>
<title>Jul 7, 2025: 2025 CLACS Summer Teacher Institute: "Childhood and Youth in Latin America" at University of Wisconsin-Millwaukee</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>This three-day program will examine the experience of childhood in Latin America, as well as the institutions, practices, and conditions that have shaped the lives of children in the region. We will consider topics like school policy, youth movements, migration experiences, health and economic factors, and cultural views of children over time. The institute will feature a variety of expert presentations (speakers may include university faculty, journalists, and non-profit leaders), and allow participants time to collaboratively discuss ways to incorporate this material in their existing curriculum.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/2025-clacs-summer-teacher-institute-childhood-and-youth-in-latin-america">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+2025+CLACS+Summer+Teacher+Institute%3A+%22Childhood+and+Youth+in+Latin+America%22&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jul+7%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThis+three-day+program+will+examine+the+experience+of+childhood+in+Latin+America%2C+as+well+as+the+institutions%2C+practices%2C+and+conditions+that+have+shaped+the+lives+of+children+in+the+region.+We+will+consider+topics+like+school+policy%2C+youth+movements%2C+migration+experiences%2C+health+and+economic+factors%2C+and+cultural+views+of+children+over+time.+The+institute+will+feature+a+variety+of+expert+presentations+%28speakers+may+include+university+faculty%2C+journalists%2C+and+non-profit+leaders%29%2C+and+allow+participants+time+to+collaboratively+discuss+ways+to+incorporate+this+material+in+their+existing+curriculum.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2F2025-clacs-summer-teacher-institute-childhood-and-youth-in-latin-america%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<item>
<title>Jul 10, 2025: RCR Workshop: Research Data Management at MARC - Management & Advanced Research</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Presented by: Sonia Santana Arroyo, Research &amp; Data Repository Manager</p> <p>The workshop covers the fundamentals of Research Data Management (RDM), highlighting its importance throughout the research lifecycle while specifically introducing FIU Libraries' data services, including the Research Data Portal built on Dataverse technology. The presentation explains how proper data management enhances research integrity, efficiency, and compliance with funding requirements, while providing practical guidance on data preparation, formatting, and repository selection.</p> <p>Please RSVP by clicking the "Register" button at the top so we can ensure we have enough availability! Thank you so much!</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/rcr-workshop-research-data-management">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+RCR+Workshop%3A+Research+Data+Management&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jul+10%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0APresented+by%3A+Sonia+Santana+Arroyo%2C+Research+%26+Data+Repository+Manager%0A%0AThe+workshop+covers+the+fundamentals+of+Research+Data+Management+%28RDM%29%2C+highlighting+its+importance+throughout+the+research+lifecycle+while+specifically+introducing+FIU+Libraries%27+data+services%2C+including+the+Research+Data+Portal+built+on+Dataverse+technology.+The+presentation+explains+how+proper+data+management+enhances+research+integrity%2C+efficiency%2C+and+compliance+with+funding+requirements%2C+while+providing+practical+guidance+on+data+preparation%2C+formatting%2C+and+repository+selection.%0A%0APlease+RSVP+by+clicking+the+%22Register%22+button+at+the+top+so+we+can+ensure+we+have+enough+availability%21+Thank+you+so+much%21%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Frcr-workshop-research-data-management%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<item>
<title>Jul 11, 2025: Sinema Chat-28th Annual Haitian Summer Institute Lecture Series at SIPA II</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Sinema Chat is a curated film screening and interactive conversation exploring Haitian identity, memory, diaspora, and belonging. The program features five award-winning short filmsâ€”Tifi, La Vie, Konpa, Boat People, and Prestigeâ€”that reflect on personal and national histories shaping Haitian communities across generations. Following the screening, a lecture will delve into the lived and cultural experiences that inspired each film. The event concludes with Sinema Chat, a dynamic, audience-driven dialogue where viewers engage directly with the filmmaker in an open, conversational format. This unique approach invites deeper reflection on migration, resilience, and the power of storytelling in the Haitian experience.</p> <p>GUEST SPEAKER: Alâ€™ikens Placher is a filmmaker from Haiti. His films have won various awards and screened at a variety of festivals, including winning an HBO BEST SHORT FILM award, having both a world premiere in competition at TRIBECA FILM FESTIVAL, and an OSCAR-QUALIFIED short film.</p> <p>In Haitian Creole. Part of LACCâ€™s Foreign Languages Across the Curriculum (FLAC) Lecture Series and LACCâ€™s Haitian Studies Program of Excellence. Made possible with support from LACCâ€™s US Department of Education Title VI Grant.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/sinema-chat-28th-annual-haitian-summer-institute-lecture-series">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Sinema+Chat-28th+Annual+Haitian+Summer+Institute+Lecture+Series&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jul+11%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0ASinema+Chat+is+a+curated+film+screening+and+interactive+conversation+exploring+Haitian+identity%2C+memory%2C+diaspora%2C+and+belonging.+The+program+features+five+award-winning+short+films%E2%80%94Tifi%2C+La+Vie%2C+Konpa%2C+Boat+People%2C+and+Prestige%E2%80%94that+reflect+on+personal+and+national+histories+shaping+Haitian+communities+across+generations.+Following+the+screening%2C+a+lecture+will+delve+into+the+lived+and+cultural+experiences+that+inspired+each+film.+The+event+concludes+with+Sinema+Chat%2C+a+dynamic%2C+audience-driven+dialogue+where+viewers+engage+directly+with+the+filmmaker+in+an+open%2C+conversational+format.+This+unique+approach+invites+deeper+reflection+on+migration%2C+resilience%2C+and+the+power+of+storytelling+in+the+Haitian+experience.%0A%0AGUEST+SPEAKER%3A+Al%E2%80%99ikens+Placher+is+a+filmmaker+from+Haiti.+His+films+have+won+various+awards+and+screened+at+a+variety+of+festivals%2C+including+winning+an+HBO+BEST+SHORT+FILM+award%2C+having+both+a+world+premiere+in+competition+at+TRIBECA+FILM+FESTIVAL%2C+and+an+OSCAR-QUALIFIED+short+film.%0A%0AIn+Haitian+Creole.+Part+of+LACC%E2%80%99s+Foreign+Languages+Across+the+Curriculum+%28FLAC%29+Lecture+Series+and+LACC%E2%80%99s+Haitian+Studies+Program+of+Excellence.+Made+possible+with+support+from+LACC%E2%80%99s+US+Department+of+Education+Title+VI+Grant.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fsinema-chat-28th-annual-haitian-summer-institute-lecture-series%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Prospective students are invited to experience FIU with their guests and witness firsthand what South Florida's Preeminent State Research University has to offer. During this fun and interactive event, you will learn more about FIU featured academic programs at MMC offered by College of Business, College of Communication, Architecture + The Arts (CARTA), Honors College, and Steven J. Green School of International &amp; Public Affairs. <item>
<title>Jul 16, 2025: Congressional Softball Game at Watkins Recreation Center</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>The Congressional Womenâ€™s Softball Game began in 2009 with captains Rep. Debbie Wasserman Schultz (D-FL), Rep. Jo Ann Emerson (R-MO), Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D-NY) and Sen. Susan Collins (R-ME). They brought together a team of women Members of Congress to play the female campaign staff from both parties after Debbie Wasserman Schultz announced her own battle with breast cancer. In 2010, the Members asked the women of the Washington, D.C. press corps to join the game as the opponent and a lasting rivalry was born. The Congressional Womenâ€™s Softball Game has raised more than $3.7M for Young Survival Coalition (YSC) since the Game began and has become a staple of Capitol Hill summer activities.</p> <p>YSC is the premier global organization dedicated to the critical issues unique to young adults who are diagnosed with breast cancer. They offer resources, connections and outreach so young adults feel supported, empowered and hopeful. Breast cancer is something few young women ever think will happen to them â€“ and certainly not at such an early age. When faced with a diagnosis, they may feel confused, angry and isolated. YSC is a place where young adults can go to find a circle of support and the best information available to navigate their treatment and their lives.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/congressional-softball-game">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Congressional+Softball+Game&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Jul+16%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThe+Congressional+Women%E2%80%99s+Softball+Game+began+in+2009+with+captains+Rep.+Debbie+Wasserman+Schultz+%28D-FL%29%2C+Rep.+Jo+Ann+Emerson+%28R-MO%29%2C+Sen.+Kirsten+Gillibrand+%28D-NY%29+and+Sen.+Susan+Collins+%28R-ME%29.+They+brought+together+a+team+of+women+Members+of+Congress+to+play+the+female+campaign+staff+from+both+parties+after+Debbie+Wasserman+Schultz+announced+her+own+battle+with+breast+cancer.++In+2010%2C+the+Members+asked+the+women+of+the+Washington%2C+D.C.+press+corps+to+join+the+game+as+the+opponent+and+a+lasting+rivalry+was+born.+The+Congressional+Women%E2%80%99s+Softball+Game+has+raised+more+than+%243.7M+for+Young+Survival+Coalition+%28YSC%29+since+the+Game+began+and+has+become+a+staple+of+Capitol+Hill+summer+activities.%0A%0AYSC+is+the+premier+global+organization+dedicated+to+the+critical+issues+unique+to+young+adults+who+are+diagnosed+with+breast+cancer.+They+offer+resources%2C+connections+and+outreach+so+young+adults+feel+supported%2C+empowered+and+hopeful.+Breast+cancer+is+something+few+young+women+ever+think+will+happen+to+them+%E2%80%93+and+certainly+not+at+such+an+early+age.+When+faced+with+a+diagnosis%2C+they+may+feel+confused%2C+angry+and+isolated.+YSC+is+a+place+where+young+adults+can+go+to+find+a+circle+of+support+and+the+best+information+available+to+navigate+their+treatment+and+their+lives.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcongressional-softball-game%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>

<title>Aug 14, 2025: Last Day to Route Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy to GPD</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Thursday, August 14, 2025 is the last day to route the Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy to the Graduate Program Director. For questions, please email <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> </p> <p>Please email to <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> and <a href="mailto:dgoldfar@fiu.edu">dgoldfar@fiu.edu</a>: (1) memo from PD stating student successfully completed requirements to advance to candidacy and (2) If applicable, copy of studentâ€™s qualifying paper(s) (e.g., publication; grant submission; qualifying paper such as chapter) â€“ this will vary depending on the program you are in as some programs do not have a paper requirement but an exam requirement.</p> <p>Please have your committee complete CASE rubrics and send to <a href="mailto:psygrad@fiu.edu">psygrad@fiu.edu</a> and <a href="mailto:dgoldfar@fiu.edu">dgoldfar@fiu.edu</a></p> <p>The Program for Doctoral Degree and Application for Candidacy Form and required paperwork can be found at Online Dissertation Milestones - University Graduate School</p> <p>To be eligible and what you will be asked:</p> <p>Complete all coursework and required number of credits.Pass all comprehensive and qualifying examination(s), as established by each academic department. These may include language requirements or other departmental requirements (if any).Maintained a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPACleared any incomplete grade(s)Any transfer of credits must be reflected in the FIU transcript prior to submission of this dissertation milestone.In general, doctoral students advanced to candidacy with a minimum of 60 graduate credits.Approved candidacy is required to commence dissertation credits enrollment.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/copy-of-last-day-to-route-program-for-doctoral-degree-and-application-for-candidacy-to-gpd-3460">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Last+Day+to+Route+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+to+GPD&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Aug+14%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AThursday%2C+August+14%2C+2025+is+the+last+day+to+route+the+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+to+the+Graduate+Program+Director.+For+questions%2C+please+email+psygrad%40fiu.edu+%0A%0APlease+email+to+psygrad%40fiu.edu+and+dgoldfar%40fiu.edu%3A+%281%29+memo+from+PD+stating+student+successfully+completed+requirements+to+advance+to+candidacy+and+%282%29+If+applicable%2C+copy+of+student%E2%80%99s+qualifying+paper%28s%29+%28e.g.%2C+publication%3B+grant+submission%3B+qualifying+paper+such+as+chapter%29+%E2%80%93+this+will+vary+depending+on+the+program+you+are+in+as+some+programs+do+not+have+a+paper+requirement+but+an+exam+requirement.%0A%0APlease+have+your+committee+complete+CASE+rubrics+and+send+to+psygrad%40fiu.edu+and+dgoldfar%40fiu.edu%0A%0AThe+Program+for+Doctoral+Degree+and+Application+for+Candidacy+Form+and+required+paperwork+can+be+found+at+Online+Dissertation+Milestones+-+University+Graduate+School%0A%0ATo+be+eligible+and+what+you+will+be+asked%3A%0A%0AComplete+all+coursework+and+required+number+of+credits.Pass+all+comprehensive+and+qualifying+examination%28s%29%2C+as+established+by+each+academic+department.+These+may+include+language+requirements+or+other+departmental+requirements+%28if+any%29.Maintained+a+3.0+or+higher+cumulative+GPACleared+any+incomplete+grade%28s%29Any+transfer+of+credits+must+be+reflected+in+the+FIU+transcript+prior+to+submission+of+this+dissertation+milestone.In+general%2C+doctoral+students+advanced+to+candidacy+with+a+minimum+of+60+graduate+credits.Approved+candidacy+is+required+to+commence+dissertation+credits+enrollment.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fcopy-of-last-day-to-route-program-for-doctoral-degree-and-application-for-candidacy-to-gpd-3460%0A">Email <item>
<title>Aug 16, 2025: August Summer Showcase at MMC - Modesto A. Maidique Campus</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>Prospective students are invited to experience FIU with their guests and witness firsthand what South Florida's Preeminent State Research University has to offer. During this fun and interactive event, you will learn more about FIU featured academic programs be able to attend engaging sessions about the admissions process and scholarship opportunities, take a campus tour, and much more.</p> <p> </p> <p>The following Colleges, Schools, and Programs will present academic sessions at the August 16 event:</p> <p>College of Arts, Sciences &amp; Education (CASE)</p> <p>College of Business in collaboration with Chaplin School of Hospitality &amp; Tourism Management</p> <p>College of Communication, Architecture + The Arts (CARTA)</p> <p>College of Engineering and Computing</p> <p>Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine in collaboration with the Office of Pre-Health Advising</p> <p>Honors College</p> <p>Nicole Wertheim College of Nursing and Health Sciences</p> <p>Pre-Law Advising and Training Office (PLATO) in collaboration with the Department of Politics &amp; International Relations</p> <p>Robert Stempel College of Public Health and Social Work</p> <p>Steven J. <![CDATA[ <p>This one-hour Lucidchart webinar for instructors and teaching staff will review how instructors are using Lucid in their class and cover how to add engaging learning activities inside of Canvas using the new Lucid for Education integration to:</p> <p>â€¢ Brainstorm</p> <p>â€¢ Annotate</p> <p>â€¢ Collaborate</p> <p>â€¢ Scaffold</p> <p>â€¢ Explore hundreds of ready to use examples and templates!</p> <p>There are two Lucid tools available through Canvas that we will cover: Lucidspark and Lucidchart. Lucidspark is a digital whiteboard designed to support collaboration and increase student engagement during class. <item>
<title>Sep 30, 2025: Blockchain Today and Tomorrow at RDB - Rafael Diaz-Balart Law Building</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>A series of public lectures featuring blockchain legal expert and adjunct professor Marc Powers, Esq. focused on the intersection between blockchain and the law, its current and future challenges, and promises that lie ahead. </p> <p>12:30 to 2:00 p.m. </p> <p>FIU College of Law </p> <p>Free and open to the FIU academic community and the public </p> <p>September 30, 2024: Blockchain 101: Everything you need to know about blockchain technology, its regulation, and crimes (RDB 1006). </p> <p>October 14, 2024: Blockchain and Elections: Which Presidential candidate will be much better for crypto prices and blockchain development? (RDB 2080). </p> <p>November 5, 2024: Two Years Later: Why did FTX fail? Is Sam Bankman a monster or misunderstood whiz kid? (RDB 2080). </p> <p>November 26, 2024: Just in time for the Holidays: How to successfully invest and make money in digital assets/crypto/blockchain businesses? (RDB 2080). </p> <p>This series is presented by the Office of International and Graduates Studies at FIU Law. </p> <p>About the speaker: Adjunct Professor Marc Powers is a Chambers Ranked Securities Law and Litigation Partner Retired from Law Firm Practice with 40 years of legal experience, including his last 20 years at two AMLAW 50 law firms and five years at SEC. Powers has demonstrated expertise in advising both U.S. and foreign businesses in all their legal affairs, including Securities Regulation, SEC Defense, Corporate Governance, Cryptocurrencies and other Blockchain related matters.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/blockchain-today-and-tomorrow-2410">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Blockchain+Today+and+Tomorrow&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Sep+30%2C+2025%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AA+series+of+public+lectures+featuring+blockchain+legal+expert+and+adjunct+professor+Marc+Powers%2C+Esq.+focused+on+the+intersection+between+blockchain+and+the+law%2C+its+current+and+future+challenges%2C+and+promises+that+lie+ahead.+%0A%0A12%3A30+to+2%3A00+p.m.+%0A%0AFIU+College+of+Law+%0A%0AFree+and+open+to+the+FIU+academic+community+and+the+public+%0A%0ASeptember+30%2C+2024%3A+Blockchain+101%3A+Everything+you+need+to+know+about+blockchain+technology%2C+its+regulation%2C+and+crimes+%28RDB+1006%29.+%0A%0AOctober+14%2C+2024%3A+Blockchain+and+Elections%3A+Which+Presidential+candidate+will+be+much+better+for+crypto+prices+and+blockchain+development%3F+%28RDB+2080%29.+%0A%0ANovember+5%2C+2024%3A+Two+Years+Later%3A+Why+did+FTX+fail%3F+Is+Sam+Bankman+a+monster+or+misunderstood+whiz+kid%3F+%28RDB+2080%29.+%0A%0ANovember+26%2C+2024%3A+Just+in+time+for+the+Holidays%3A+How+to+successfully+invest+and+make+money+in+digital+assets%2Fcrypto%2Fblockchain+businesses%3F+%28RDB+2080%29.+%0A%0AThis+series+is+presented+by+the+Office+of+International+and+Graduates+Studies+at+FIU+Law.+%0A%0AAbout+the+speaker%3A+Adjunct+Professor+Marc+Powers+is+a+Chambers+Ranked+Securities+Law+and+Litigation+Partner+Retired+from+Law+Firm+Practice+with+40+years+of+legal+experience%2C+including+his+last+20+years+at+two+AMLAW+50+law+firms+and+five+years+at+SEC.+Powers+has+demonstrated+expertise+in+advising+both+U.S.+and+foreign+businesses+in+all+their+legal+affairs%2C+including+Securities+Regulation%2C+SEC+Defense%2C+Corporate+Governance%2C+Cryptocurrencies+and+other+Blockchain+related+matters.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fblockchain-today-and-tomorrow-2410%0A">Email <item>
<title>Apr 7, 2026: Veterans and Military Affairs Inaugural Fly-In at FIU in DC</title>
<description>
<![CDATA[ <p>FIUâ€™s DC Fly-Ins are three-day experiential seminars focused on exploring how policies are made, and what career opportunities exist in the capital for students passionate about a variety of issues. The itineraries consist of engaging conversations and experiences with experts across government, academia and industry. Each Fly-In includes an opportunity to draft policy solutions and to participate in advocacy meetings on Capitol Hill.</p> <p><a href="https://calendar.fiu.edu/event/veterans-and-military-affairs-inaugural-fly-in">View on site</a> | <a href="mailto:?subject=I+found+an+interesting+event%3A+Veterans+and+Military+Affairs+Inaugural+Fly-In&amp;body=I+found+an+interesting+event+you+may+like%3A%0A%0A%0ADate%3A+Apr+7%2C+2026%0A%0ADescription%3A%0AFIU%E2%80%99s+DC+Fly-Ins+are+three-day+experiential+seminars+focused+on+exploring+how+policies+are+made%2C+and+what+career+opportunities+exist+in+the+capital+for+students+passionate+about+a+variety+of+issues.+The+itineraries+consist+of+engaging+conversations+and+experiences+with+experts+across+government%2C+academia+and+industry.+Each+Fly-In+includes+an+opportunity+to+draft+policy+solutions+and+to+participate+in+advocacy+meetings+on+Capitol+Hill.%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fcalendar.fiu.edu%2Fevent%2Fveterans-and-military-affairs-inaugural-fly-in%0A">Email this event</a></p> ]]>
